website_summaries.verdict: The Klipsch Image S4i II in-ear headphones add a new, more durable tangle-resistant flat cord while retaining the S4 model's very respectable sound quality and superior comfort.
pros: The Klipsch Image S4i II in-ear headphones have the same impressive sound and fit as the original S4i model but they're more durable and have a tangle-resistant flat cord
There's an integrated Apple-friendly remote/microphone and they come with a nice, compact carrying case
cons: Opt for other models in the S4 line if you want Android compatibility or better sweat resistance
bass lovers probably won't be satisfied by the amount of bass

customer_reviews.title: I love them and I hate them
customer_reviews.text: I always buy Klipsch even though they don't last long. I buy them because they're the only earbuds that I've found that fit comfortably in my ear. The sound quality is great, but they just break so easily. This pair didn't break but it is susceptible to static shocks in the ear. Whenever I wear fuzzy clothing with the earbuds in, or open a trash bag, it shocks my ear and it's a little painful. Also, it makes a electronic glitchy sound every 15 minutes or so, which is problematic especially when I'm trying to fall asleep. After going through about 5 Klipsch buds, I've had enough.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Michelson

customer_reviews.title: I bought these 4 years ago. Verdict?
customer_reviews.text: So, according to Amazon I bought this on March 2, 2014. Today is May 16, 2018, and I STILL use these headphones (yes, I take care of my products). Every time I finish using these, I put them back in the carrying pouch. I know some reviews state that these headphones don't last long, but here I am, 4 years later with an amazing pair of headphones. I fully recommend these to anyone looking for a solid pair of earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Chang

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT TRUST KLIPSCH'S RETURN POLICY.
customer_reviews.text: I love Klipsch. But I had to buy a more expensive pair to replace these. Pros: Great sound. Cons: Within a month, the left channel stopped working. Within three months, neither channel worked. The remote worked, but not the sound! Returns are impossibly hard once Amazon's window is closed. Though the warranty is for a year, Klipsch makes it impossible to return from their website. They direct you to the reseller. So, neither Klipsch or Amazon will help. Earbuds are so small that they are awkward to fit in the ear canal, and I've nearly lost a rubber bud in my ear canal. Can be painful to wear. They fall out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Smakhi

customer_reviews.title: Good for audio books.
customer_reviews.text: IMO, this earbud set is a bit overpriced for the quality of sound (tinny)...my Apple iPhone earbuds have better sound. I'm a heavy audiobook user, and these are still working...I think I've had then for about 9 months or so. What I DO like about these buds is that you can fast forward (two clicks and hold) and go backwards (three clicks and hold) through an audio book. Recently, occasionally none of the buttons would worked, but I found if I take out, then replace the earphone jack, the buttons start working again...minor inconvenience. I would recommend these earbuds for audiobooks, but not for music.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Biedermann

customer_reviews.title: 4th time I'm buying these - because they're the best!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these headphones 4 times by now, and I've been using them as my primary headphones since 2009. They're fantastic. Comfortable, well-sealing, and sounds amazing. Better than my Sennheised HD-280 Pros. Why did I buy them 4 times? First pair got shredded during a motorcycle trip, where i rode 4 hours in a torrential downpour through seattle, and when i got off the bike, I was so zonked that i tore them apart when yanking my helmet off. Second pair was lying underneath the bed when I Dyson'd 'em up. Neither the vacuum nor the earphones survived. The third pair I lost while out drinking. The fourth pair I'm using right now, to rock out with.
customer_reviews.author: Niels Joubert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Love the no-tangle wires. My hearing is impaired, so I really like that these earbuds produce outstanding sound quality and do not produce too much base.
customer_reviews.author: Poppariley

customer_reviews.title: Good, but......
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, Klipsch has always had great products. The headphones are great and have amazing sound. The only gripe that I have is that after a while these headphones do go bad and the sound begins to get warped. I wish that for the money it would last longer, but I assume all headphones have to go at some point. Would have been nice to get a refund on this or a warranty swap due to the lack of sound quality after 8 months of use, but when it did work it worked GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Irf

customer_reviews.title: ... had another pair of Klipsch buds that looked just like this that I bought at Bestbuy 2 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I had another pair of Klipsch buds that looked just like this that I bought at Bestbuy 2 years ago. They eventually broke with heavy travel usage but the sound was amazing! They cost $90 but were well worth it compared to the $300+ of Bose in ears. A little white noise box isn't worth $200. I thought buying the s4i-II I'd get that sound quality again but these must be the downgraded version. Still decent sound, but not that top notch quality you will find with some good overears or bose/beats in ears
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than a week.
customer_reviews.text: I got 6 years out of my S4i Klipsch earbuds before they died. This pair of S4i-II was not an improvement. They didn't even last 6 days. They started changing the volume or pausing my music without being touched (my phone was in my bag or pocket, not my hand). Unplugging them from my phone and then plugging them back in seemed to reset them, but then it would happen again a few minutes later. Finally, the 3-button controller stopped working completely. Back they go.
customer_reviews.author: Not Dottie Parker

customer_reviews.title: This product was great, it worked fine for about 4months then the ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was great, it worked fine for about 4months then the remote stopped working and the plastic tip start to become loose and finally the thing stopped working after 8-9months. great sound quality and loved the untangle-able wire construction.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for really small ear canals
customer_reviews.text: I specifically tried these earbuds because I have trouble finding ones that will fit in my small ear canals AND that are comfortable -- Problem solved. Very high quality materials and workmanship. I'm no audiophile, but the sound coming from these headphones is awesome. In fact, it is the best sounding earbud I have ever owned. The excellent price was a bonus! Try them.
customer_reviews.author: doniAnonymous

customer_reviews.title: A real let down
customer_reviews.text: Leading up to my purchase, I was really to excited to check these out to see what the hype was all about. Once I got them I felt like they were a bit on the cheaper side of material quality, but I thought that it would be fine. They sounded really good. Probably the best earphones I used up until that point. After a month of use they stopped working. I was shook since they were never put through anything that could damage them, unless putting them in the case damages the headphones. Over all, pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Almaraz

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is impressive (no doubt on that) for a below $40 earphone. The cables are very noisy (this is a design flaw that should be corrected). I didn't use them for commuting or even short walks. You can use them while the cables doesn't move! The fit on my ear canal was good althouhg I needed from time to time to push them back to have a perfect fit. After two month of usage the right channel died. I want to remark that I was very carefull while wearing them. I like the case very much. Good design and I can still use it (with another earphones!)
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Aveledo

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds worked great for about a year but now the right side has no sound. For the price, I would expect them to work for much longer. The main reason I purchased these was their compatibility with my iPhone. I purchased a much cheaper pair of Symphonized ear buds, around the same time, for my Android tablet and they continue to work just fine and sound just as good as well. So, save your money and purchase something cheaper since I could have purchased 5 pairs of the Symphonized for one of these.
customer_reviews.author: davidm

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: I guess by many standards this item could have gotten five stars but for me, I save five stars for something really spectacular. Still tough, this is a great product. I often fall asleep with my head sets on. On the cheaper head sets this practice soon breaks the connection at or near the head set. The flat wire seems to be quite strong and so far with more usage than normal, I have had no problems in this regard. The sound quality exceeds any other head set I have owned. To be fair, I generally buy cheaper head set. As for the fit in the ear, I had no idea it could be so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Addicted to bass?
customer_reviews.text: They're okay.... nearly got knocked down/tripped/couldn't hear anyone with these in my ears... music's too good and all external noise was successfully blocked out :) Update: April 2015: The right side is SPOILT. No sound coming out of it. There are other reviewers who said this was quite flimsy and prone to damage, and I agree. These IEMs have been sitting in my office for the past 12 months, i.e., they haven't gone out, i.e., usage was truly as gentle as it could be, and yet they're still spoilt. Slightly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Saffron

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, poor fit
customer_reviews.text: I was real excited to get these b/c of the controls, the sound reviews and the non tangle wires but I am still using my $5 ear buds...why? The weight of the buds make them fall out of my ear, and I have tried about 5 different ear ends. The controller works with the volume really well but not the pause/fast foward/rewind. I continually press it twice to jump to the next song and it pauses and starts again. It's a hassle and not worth the trouble for the buds to continually fall out of my ear, so I leave them home.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Recommended buy
customer_reviews.text: This headset has a great sound. I have been wanting to buy these from some time and snagged a deal on thanksgiving. Quality of sound is the biggest plus. As some reviewers pointed out, the cord makes some noise while working out. Other than that, its a great set of headphones. I wouldn't write it off just because of the cord noise. Recommended. Updating the review to add below: Actually, the cord does make that irritating chirpy sound all the time as it touches any surface so a great headset if sitting around but not while moving and using to take calls on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones, only problem is the cord is just too long
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound amazing. The MSRP is a bit ridiculous, but I picked them up on Black Friday for $40 - what a steal! I love the remote and the flat, tangle-free cable is great. Only problem is that it is just way to long. I would have liked them for the gym but even tucked under your shirt they are just dangerously long, constantly at risk of tangling on something. However, for a causal pair of buds, these sound better than my Harman Kardon sets by a longshot, and are so much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Daniels

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic in-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic in-ear headphones, and Klipsch customer service is great. I had them for just under a year when they stopped working in one ear. Klipsch sent a replacement very quickly and with out any fuss. The replacement pair has now been working no problems for over a year. The buttons on the remote are easy to use, and function well. The microphone is good and I haven't had any complaints from people, I've spoken too. My only minor complaint is the wire is a bit un-flexable and can get in the way at times. It also transmits movement noise to the ears.
customer_reviews.author: JLin

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and Sound
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a fan of Klipsch and these don't disappoint. They are everything that I hoped for and more. I like Klipsch because they offer and deep inter-ear type of fit which is great for cutting out noise from the lawnmower or other noisy items. One tip, don't leave them in your shorts and put them in the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jetson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ear-buds, much improved with no-tangle flat cord.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a failed earlier version of these ear-buds (one channel dropped out likely due to a failed cord) with these that were offered as "refurbished". I'm happy with the transaction price and delivery speed. I withheld the 5th star because they did not include all the various sized ear pieces that should come with a "refurbished" version. I would describe these as "used' or "returned" not "refurbished". The latter indicates it would have a box, sack and spare ear pieces.
customer_reviews.author: W. Chiles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me, I regular person.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a musician or a sound fanatic. I like to listen to music while I am exercising, traveling, and while I am doing chores in the house. I like to hear my music clearly and get absorbed into its multifold layers. I don't know the technical terms, but I don't enjoy it when I hear "all singing voices" or "just booming bases" while all other sounds are weak and tremulous. Klipsch S4 feeds the music from my iPhone to my ear drums in a very satisfying and comfortable way. Using the S4 for phone conversations also works great (no static or disruptive ambient sounds). Ear buds are very soft and comfortable; comes in various sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Coast2Coast

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price. Works with iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, works perfect with iPhone & good value for the price. SIRI works much better on the iPhone with these if you want accurate results The sound quality is very detailed & base response is perfect for me. If you have a dedicated headphone amp they are really great. Highly recommended. I have owned several other high end headphones for many years... However, for $29 the new Apple head buds are a much better choice if you have a limited budget or are traveling. Apple has really improved these second generation head buds. They come with the latest Apple devices.
customer_reviews.author: LittleBearLodge

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I thought they would be
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as I thought they would be. Cord is very heavy and cumbersome at times. When you run, there is a lot of accessory noise that you hear when the cord swings around and rubs against your shirt. Because the cord is heavy, it also pulls the earphones out, unless you have something to hold it in place. The cord is very durable though and does it's job of not tangling (as described). Not a bad product, however, I just wasn't completely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: I took very good care to never stress the cable
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted 1 year and 3 months before a wire shorted and I lost the right ear completely. I took very good care to never stress the cable, and to always store the headphones properly. For many months of this product’s life the headphones sat unused. I would estimate the actual "regular use" period to be ~6mo, which makes these seem particularly shoddy. Upon contacting Klipsch, I discovered that QUALITY PHOTO is not an authorized retailer, and as such there was no available Klipsch warranty. BEWARE. If there’s any problem with these you will not have any recourse.
customer_reviews.author: Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Where to find
customer_reviews.text: they should never stop making these. nice for $30 now??
customer_reviews.author: inFlorida

customer_reviews.title: the quality was great before going wrong after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: the quality was great before going wrong after 1 year! I did not expect this expensive pair goes wrong that soon!Although I love the quality of Klipsch but I had 2 bad experiences!I never gonna buy klipsch again! the factory will hardly support you although it has warranty! I had the same issue with my recent klipsch on ear headphones which went wrong after 2 months! and the main factory does not change it although on the original pack it says that it has 2 years warranty just make sure about the policies and warranties before buying it
customer_reviews.author: MOHAMMADHOSSEIN MAHZOON

customer_reviews.title: no stars!
customer_reviews.text: nice rich sound; build quality good so far but too new to tell. Followup review 03-16-2015 Just over 3 months and the product no longer works. Buyer beware. I cannot find information on how to contact Quality Photo the seller of this product as there name is no longer a link you can click and start the contact process. I cannot return it because Amazon says it's beyond the return date. Klipsch will not warranty the product because Quality Photo is not an authorized seller. This is no doubt a knock-off product. It will fail after several months of usage. Buyer beware of Quality Photo items for sale.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D.

customer_reviews.title: Second time isn't a charm
customer_reviews.text: The previous version was great but got stuck in the stair master and died. I jump. On Amazon and see they have an updated version so I go for it. This version is fine soundwise but as far as build goes the ear buds pop out a lot and all of a sudden the in-line mic stopped working. Also the thin cord seemed cool but it makes a lot of noise when you work out. I had the s4i for a year and had no problems. This was not even six months the and is broken. Get the older version if you plan on using these daily at the gym. They're better.
customer_reviews.author: Hashi

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvements over the S4i. Still has the best sound
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Klipsch Image S4i headphones, and now I love the S4i-II too. Huge improvements over the deficiencies in the former. The cable is a ribbon now and doesn't fray. Also, it's black and gray instead of the dirt magnet white that it was before. The shirt clip holds on much better. The case is actually useful too, as opposed to the old one. And of course, absolutely still has the best sound quality for earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brinkworth

customer_reviews.title: Buy these earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: These earphones are the best ones I have ever tried. I've had several pairs that either broke because of cheap plastic parts or slipped out of my ears during a workout or on the go or just didn't have good enough sound quality. These fit your ears perfectly because of their oval shape, they won't slip out from sweaty or oily ears, and they have amazingly clear sound with good bass. There are better earphones out there if you want to spend 150+ but I got these for 40 and I am very satisfied in every way by these earbuds. They integrate well with iPhones.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Earbuds, Sad they are discontinued!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried 5 other corded earbuds and though these are dis cool to use they are one of the best and stay put when running. Bought 2 pairs so I can use them for a while. I had a pair for 5 years and they finally broke. I bought the comfort foam to use on them and try block out ambient noise very well.
customer_reviews.author: CBD

customer_reviews.title: Good sound great price
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up on black Friday for $40. Recommended by The Absolute Sound and I can see why. Well balanced sound, sturdy construction with anti-tangle cables. Provided good sound and noise isolation (of course they are not noise cancelling) on a recent transatlantic flight, with my iPod as well as for the in-flight movies. Compared to my previous NuForce phones, they can play louder with less distortion. Good detail, good balance of bass, mid and high frequencies
customer_reviews.author: G. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good - quality is questionable
customer_reviews.text: I should be fair and say that sound quality is good and ambient sound attenuation is very good. What I don't like is the fact that they break easily. It seems the cable connection to the 3.5mm connector is fragile. Klipsch replaced already 2 sets for me. Their service is decent so it is not a huge deal but it is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan G

customer_reviews.title: Mine lasted 2 months and they replaced it for free.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is fantastic. Unfortunately, as other reviewers have noted, they're built to break about two to three months later. If you want any durability at all, avoid these. Also, the microphone placement made it so people only heard me when I held the microphone closer to my mouth, rather defeating the purpose. Perhaps I got a faulty model. I'm writing them next, and if they're willing to replace it, I'll change this review and note their quality customer service. EDIT: They replaced it for me, no questions asked. No hassle whatsoever. They even sent me a different model that had the microphone closer to the mouth so I'm changing the review from one star to four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Shuback

customer_reviews.title: Great audio quality though
customer_reviews.text: Same problem i get with cheaper earphones. At some point, one of the speakers stopped working, until i twisted the jack around. Eventually, they all failed. Threw them away. Great audio quality though, great packaging as well.
customer_reviews.author: edgar Ondati

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, not certain about the sound quality matching previous models.  Not bad, just not quite as good.
customer_reviews.text: I like these earphones and they are well made. However, I don't think they sound as good as my previous two pairs of similar model. I travel a lot, and lost the two previous pairs... it was not that they broke or wore out. I have been overall very happy with the quality and price point of Klipsch in-ear headphones. I love the flat cord which make it easy taking them out and not having to untangle. Am just a bit concerned about the sound quality, but I have only used them a few times since received.
customer_reviews.author: hma

customer_reviews.title: My experience is not so good
customer_reviews.text: Nonfunctional after about 8 mos. I have had previous s4is and also needed warranty replacement. Avoid like the plague. After contacting the warranty support, it says they will respond within 7 business days. I don't know about you, but 7 business days before even contacting me about my nonfunctional headphones is unacceptably long. Not thrilled with Klipsch at the moment, and will likely be exploring a new go-to headphone brand.
customer_reviews.author: ZPS

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones / headset for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: While not ideal for active / athletic use (will easily come out of your ears), these headphones are great for the office. The noise isolating rubber help block out office noise. The controls on the cord are great for skipping songs as well. The headset does make for a comfortable hands free calling experience, although I find a tend to talk a bit louder than normal from the noise isolating aspect of the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Alcorn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these headphones
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these headphones. Great sound quality and noise canceling capacity for the price. I lost these once and repurchased them again only to lose them within a year. I couldn't justify buying the same model again so I decided to splurge on a pair of Bose SoundTrue In-Ear headphones which. I still found myself sorely missing the Klipsch. I loved how small you could make these and how great they fit in my small ears. The no tangle cord was also great. I will admit there was a decent amount of cord noise but it never bothered me much. I honestly felt like the sound was cleaner with these compared to the Bose.
customer_reviews.author: apelia

customer_reviews.title: These sound great, but I found it really hard to figure ...
customer_reviews.text: These sound great, but I found it really hard to figure out what tip I should be using for each ear to get a good seal. I never did find one that would seal on my left ear, and I have since switched to an over-the-ear pair of headphones. I like the flat cord, the multiple tips, and the buttons, but I just didn't get the fit that I feel like I needed to fully experience what these had to offer. I still use them as my back-up headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kacie

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch S4i
customer_reviews.text: I use earbuds constantly when talking on my iPhone to clients and other callers. These earbuds have taken some getting used to for me, but I really like them. The sound quality is good and a lot of the outside noise is lessened because of the design of the earbuds. The one thing I would like to see is that a change be made to the middle button on the control. I think it would be helpful for it to be a different size or shape from the other 2 which would make it easier to identify, simply by touch, that you've selected the correct button.
customer_reviews.author: L. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Not like the old Klipsch headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones as a replacement to the older version of Klipsch headphones. I was disappointed in their quality. First, the "tangle-free" cord adds a lot of noise whenever anything touches it. The cord is also really heavy which leads to the second problem. Second, the headphones never stay in my ear. I tried all the different attachments and nothing helped. Because the cord was heavy and the attachments much different than the older version, the headphones kept popping out. Third, the sound quality does not compare to the older version. The noise-isolation is near to non-existent possibly because of the second problem. Overall recommendation: don't buy it. If you want these headphones go for the older version.
customer_reviews.author: unelunebleu

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sound quality excellent and the base is crisp. Call quality is perfect. Remove almost all background noise w/o the hiss of noise canceling. Tangle free cord design. Cons: Extended use (8+ hours at work) can cause ear fatigue. But I haven't been able to find any headphones that I can wear for 8+ hours that don't cause ear fatigue. Other: These are the best sounding headphones I have even owned for under $100
customer_reviews.author: Apollyon

customer_reviews.title: Great while they last...
customer_reviews.text: The headphones themselves are great. However, I have owned two pairs have broken in less than 6 months. Same problem both times - the buttons on the microphone stop working. PRO's: Great sound Cord never tangles The mic control buttons (play/pause/skip/vol up/vol down) CON's: There is cord noise when you exercise with these Don't last long
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Annoying noise from mic I suppose during movement
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping a lot from this, but was a big let down. The sound quality and the controls are great but only when you sit idle. Slightest movements cause a lot of noise from the mic I think and also the ear buds are noisy. Didn't like them at all and sold it off. 3 stars for the sound quality and controls. -2 for the mic positioning and noise from mic and earbuds. Will not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: nikpmd

customer_reviews.title: Get Sennheiser's instead!
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are simply not up to the quality I expected, paying sennheiser prices, and not getting anywhere near that level of sound quality or durability. They are currently sitting in my desk in the case, as the tendency for static to come across the wires became too frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jack of all trades

customer_reviews.title: Worked less than one year
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are fine, they worked well for the price but after six months one of the ear phones stopped working. I really only use these while walking my dogs, so I figured being able to hear from one ear while walking around was safer and I could live with it. Then two months after one of them going dead, the other one went dead and my Klipsch ear buds are now worthless. I tossed them in the junk drawer and went back to my original Apple supplied ear buds, which are still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: TWood

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you really get a good set of headphones. Sure, there are pricier models that'll have a little more of an edge, but personally, I feel that the marginal increase in performance you'll get won't be worth the huge price jump. The sound is balanced and clean in these headphones, yet still delivers some oomph. Plus, I really love the flat cord design. It actually works fairly well at reducing the amount of tangling you'll get.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ocean

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement in build quality versus the last model. Amazing sound and sound isolation at the perfect price point.
customer_reviews.text: Much improved over the last model. Wires are a bit more rugged and the inline control is smaller and doesn't lend itself to accidental play/pause and buttons are smaller. Amazingly solid sound and sound isolation for this price point. My favorite everyday headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jjftx

customer_reviews.title: Great head phones for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Love klipsch brand! I've used other brands before and they always either fall out of my ears easily or gives me an ear ache after an hour. This version has flat wires so it untangles easily without much yanking and pulling.
customer_reviews.author: utoppia

customer_reviews.title: Not a better deal on the market
customer_reviews.text: Not a better deal on the market. There is some minor noise when the cord rubs but it is few and far between for me. Never tangles and superior sound quality compared to other headphones on the marketing that are $100+
customer_reviews.author: Theo S.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, if you don't mind filing a warranty claim every 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is outstanding, especially for the price, however durability is seriously lacking. I will be making my second warranty claim in 6 months. These headphones are outstanding while they last, but it would be a miracle if they lasted an entire year. I thought I might have just been too rough the headphones after my first pair stopped working, and was much more careful with the replacement ones but after just 3 months, the left ear stopped working. Honestly these headphones would be outstanding, but the durability is seriously holding them back. Thankfully, Klipsch offers a 2-year warranty, but mailing headphones back to Klipsch every 3-4 months is getting old.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: They break constantly, and Klipsch will not honor their warranty
customer_reviews.text: These headphones broke a few months after I purchased them. After some delays, Klipsch replaced them in January 2014. Only a few months later, the new headphones broke also. At this point, Klipsch still has not replaced the headphones. This product comes with a two-year warranty, which was a key reason why I purchased it in the first place. However, after extensive contact with their customer service, I can only say that the company doesn't seem to care about honoring the guarantee. I would not recommend this or any Klipsch product to other shoppers. The Klipsch warranty replacement guarantee is just as unreliable as the product itself!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and fit.
customer_reviews.text: These are the only headphones I've ever bought that stay in my ear regardless of what I'm doing. I have at tragus piercing, which makes it difficult for me to find in ear headphones, but these work super well. They also sound great and have a carrying case that is really useful. I never have to untangle these!
customer_reviews.author: dahanese

customer_reviews.title: Love These
customer_reviews.text: I listen to audio books when I'm on the plane (I fly for business) or music when I'm out walking. These stay in and they have the controls on the wire so I can stop the music to take a call. The wire is flat so it doesn't get as tangled as the round wires do. The only problem I have with these I have with all of these ear bud type phones. They hide the "R" and "L" so they're really hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product as a really reliable pair of buds with great sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, heavy cord
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my lost Klipsch Image S2 buds. As I understand it, the only noticable difference between these and the S4i - I is the cord, which is flat instead of the typical round. The purpose was to keep the cord from tangling easily. I will agree 100% that the flat cord does not tangle and when I pull it out of the case it pretty much completely unwinds (think: Jack-in-the-box). The drawback is that the design makes the cord heavier than I'd prefer. But all in all the earphones are great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but cord is just too noisy.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed the comfort and sound quality of this headphone except for one major issue...the cord noise. The material they use in the cord just transmits too much noise. Hopefully Klipsch can fix this issue in their next generation S4 headphones since I sound quality is great and the oval tips make the S4i-II one of the most comfortable headphones I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Most overpriced garbage I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: These sound like a pair of 10-15 dollar headphones, yet they have a brand name so people must think they are good for some reason. I have worked in and around the music industry for a long time, and these are total trash. No sound delineation at all. Just muffled s***ty noise coming into your ears. God help you if you buy these and can't get your money back. The stock I phone 5 ear pods are way better on every level. Even though they are not high on overall clarity either they are still way better than this...
customer_reviews.author: Austin M

customer_reviews.title: the idea is great, had everything I wanted in a pair of ...
customer_reviews.text: the idea is great, had everything I wanted in a pair of earbuds, however, the volume control stopped working only after two months, and the audio became terrible (too quiet, distorted and echo-ey) only 4 months after purchase. I am disappointed with customer service for failing to provide an easy way to replace them based off the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Bose MIE2i Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these before a trip this past month. I was looking for a set of noise isolating headphones for the flight. The ear plugs are similar to the ones you would find on high-end ear plugs you would use at a firing range. The sound from these headphones is also great with not a lot of difference between them and the Bose headphones. I definitely recommend these are they are a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: AdamsBQ06

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch Ear Headphones- Image S4i
customer_reviews.text: The ear phones are really good and value for money,the spacial curved shape of ear phones makes them fitwell in ears, no stress or duress to ears the noise cancellation is excellent. The quality of sound in excellent. The flat wires doesn't entangles, which is a big relief as the stock Apple's ear phones have wires always getting entangled. The remote works fine with all Apple products, I have tried with Iphone5, Ipad and Macbook Air. All in all a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Vikas

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit and great sound
customer_reviews.text: This is my earphone of choice. Comfortable fit and great sound. Yes there is some noise with the new flat cable, but if you use the clip it isn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Offline

customer_reviews.title: Pros: comfortable - Cons: Cord Noise
customer_reviews.text: make sure you get the ones compatible for your device. I accidentally ordered the ones for Iphone although I have an android phone. Since I have the incorrect ones my buttons are not correct. mic works and start/stop works but not volume control buttons. very comfy and good sound. loud cord noise though! I have to wrap the cord around my neck so the cord noise does not over power the audio.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse S.  Liebl

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This set of headphones only worked for two months for me. I purchased them in April. Two days ago, while i was listening to a podcast they just stopped working. I can hear music, but the words and alert sounds are not audible. I checked my phone, the sound was fine without the headphones or with another pair of headphones. Just want to point out that I purchased mine through Amazon.com, not an unauthorized seller.
customer_reviews.author: shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: great sound. I have $300 earbuds that don't sound ...
customer_reviews.text: My fav. earbuds of all time. Really deep base, great sound. I have $300 earbuds that don't sound as good. My entire family has these...in different colors of course :)
customer_reviews.author: sassyll519

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service when these broke down
customer_reviews.text: I was a big fan of this brand until a bad customer experience with getting these fixed/replaced through Amazon. After spending $100 on headphones you want them to last, but these broke down abruptly one day -- first the mic stopped working about 6 months ago, then the audio quality started to drop and then they became unusable (garbled sound when listening to music). When I got in touch with customer service, I was told I was past the warranty and there was nothing they could do. Now I'm finding another place to buy quality headphones that will stand behind their warranty when an expensive product starts to break down after barely owning for 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Best I have found!
customer_reviews.text: I used to carry my bulky BOSE around the ear headphones on planes. Now I just take these to save the space. Sure they are not as good at canceling the ambient noise of the aircraft, but for me the space is more important. Also, the cord controls work very well. The quality of the sound for both phone calls and music is good enough for me(I am not an audiophile). The cord: It does not kink and is very easy to untangle after removing from a pocket.
customer_reviews.author: storm

customer_reviews.title: Headphones appear to be not quite new
customer_reviews.text: Product appears to have been repackaged as there was things that were not quite right about the wrapping. I had purchased another exact set of headphones from another vendor so I knew how it should look. I have tested out the headphones against my other pair and so far they seem to be working OK.. It was a good price, but maybenot as good as I first thought.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Thought
customer_reviews.text: i read a lot of people comments warning about how uncomfortable these headphines are and how easily they fall out the ears... and i still bought them, all i can say is that i should have listened to the other reviewers. Normally i tend to think people exagerate or are very picky. I used these for about 10 minutes and put my old ones back on. The sound on my old ones is better (to me atleast) and far more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Natural, clear sound
customer_reviews.text: The Klipsch Image S4i-II earphones are a significant improvement over Apple's provided earphones. I found Klipsch's rubber tips too loose and flimsy (they kept falling out of my ear). Replacing them with the Comply TSX-100 Comfort PLUS tips made a major difference. The sound of the earphones won't knock your socks off and I don't think they're designed to. Their sound is clear, sharp, and balanced. I was able to hear instruments and notes in music that were not audible through the Apple earphones. Now available at less than half of comparable earphones, these are a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wilen

customer_reviews.title: Microphone placement isnt great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace my older Klipsch headset that i loved. These sound great but the microphone placement is a bit off. People still have a hard time hearing you talk unless you hold the microphone closer to your face. I guess i can clip the microphone to the collar of my shirt but it would be great if the microphone was higher up on one side of the headset cord.
customer_reviews.author: MikeGainesville

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Klipsch that I have bought. As impressive as the first one. Excellent exterior noise reduction, excellent bass, robust. The first one I used for three years in heavy and some times wet conditions before it presented problems in the controls. This new model is still 100% functional. I highly recommend if you require a high quality yet very robust headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio G.

customer_reviews.title: Decent product. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones themselves are good. They sound great and are very comfortable. The flat cables aren't as good as the version 1's round cables but that isn't the end of the world. However the left side of these shorted out and stopped working within a week of light use. I would imagine this is a rare occurrence and not the end of the world. After contacting Klipsch directly, they didn't seem to care. They seemed perfectly content with losing a customer who has purchased their products for years as long as they didn't have to own up to a defective product. I'll never support this company again and I would advise you not to either.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Mastel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality that rivals even my Bose headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality that rivals even my Bose headphones. I've purchased several of these for myself and family. The cable easily untangles and the earbuds themselves are quite comfortable in the ear. Sometimes they can block a lot of ambient noise so you may have to take them out if someone needs to speak to you. Thats certainly not a complaint though!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Cornick

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! Great sound, a bunch of earbuds to choose from so you can get the perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: (: allie

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, comfortable, mediocre build quality
customer_reviews.text: These In-Ear headphones sound great. The sound quality is about the same as buying $50 headphones. The headphones are comfortable. They are also easy to clean the wax off the rubber piece. The build quality is ok. Don't expect these to last a year or more. Be easy on the wires or they may get frayed. For the price, its worth it. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Omer Saeed

customer_reviews.title: Authentic
customer_reviews.text: The S4 headphones sound amazing and are very comfortable. The headphones I received were authentic but are not covered by a warranty. I used the Klipsh serial number verification before I opened the package. If Klipsch will put a serial number on it I'm assuming the inspection process was still in tact. If they fail then I just won't buy from Klipsch again.
customer_reviews.author: Mikal

customer_reviews.title: Not noise-isolating
customer_reviews.text: Got these primarily for in-flight use for their advertised noise-isolating feature. The sound seems fine (but I'm not at all an audiophile) but unfortunately I was able to enjoy every in-flight sound. The drone of the engines seemed every bit as loud with the headphones in and out, was not able to miss a word of the conversation behind me, and was able to sympathize with the young parents each time their baby cried because I could hear him so clearly. If you are looking for noise-isolating in-ear headphones suggest you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Better than the iphone originals
customer_reviews.text: My husband kept complaining about his iphone earbuds falling out. Our son had purchased the Android version of these and liked them so I tried them for hubby. Great. He loves them. He's not an audiophile so we can't attest to that (although son is very pleased with the sound quality of his). They are very comfortable, function with the iphone features, and stay in the ears during walking and bike riding.
customer_reviews.author: A RHEA

customer_reviews.title: Don't get these for exercise, otherwise excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Sound with these headphones is excellent. However, as some of the other reviewers have mentioned, the noise when the cord moves around is quite bad. I tried to use these on the treadmill and the noise was so bad, they were useless and I pulled them out and did my run without music. Phone call quality is also excellent and if you aren't doing a lot of moving around I would highly recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Best of all my non noise reducing earbuds. I have Sony audio technica klipsch and apple. Very durable. I just throw them in my backpack yank them out when I walk to work. Cord noise can be irritating. But sound is sensational. Have Had them for three years. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: J. M Ullman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this or any other "high end" ear buds!
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of "high end" ear buds I've purchased. Second pair to fail in the first year. In this case the pause button and phone speaker stopped working after 4 months. I purchased these items thinking they would last longer than cheap ones I've owned in the past. Now I'm convinced that ear buds in general are just not durable and will need to be replaced frequently. If you want to spend 3 figured for some nice Bose or Beats over ear headphones, its not a bad idea (I own Bose now and like them a lot), but why spend $100-plus for a "disposable" product like ear buds? Might as well get the best $20 buds you can find.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Mabrie

customer_reviews.title: Audio quality for the price is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a pair of Klipsch S4's. They have been great and are still fantastic. I bought these for my wife to use with her iPhone. She is as happy as I have been with mine. I will add that if you really want to enjoy these headphones, purchase a set of Comply Foam Tips to go with them. They will improve the fit and sound cancellation. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds! But, if you've had problems with buds in the past, expect the same.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome earbuds, the sound is killer. Good sound isolation, and comfort. The one thing i would say though, is that i am one of those people who have always had problems with earbuds falling out of my ear every 40 seconds if i'm walking around. .... These are no different.. If you are walking (even if i try multiple tips) , the buds fall out of my ear, and need readjusting every 40 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: kyle Rashad

customer_reviews.title: DON'T!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. When I first received them the remote did not work. The button to raise the volume did not work and the one to lower the volume actually raised it. After a month and a day of using them they completely stopped working. I have owned $5, $10, $20, $30 earphones and these $50 ones. Out of all the ones I have ever owned these are the most expensive and the worst ones I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, good fit, good controls – Terrible lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first set and was happy; they fit great, controls are nice, sound is good. Then I started to get the occasional dropout in sound which I put down to cable noise or ambient sound. Then the controls failed, then the sound dropped out with every movement. This was in less than 2 months of owning them. Amazon was great, refunded me amount and sent a second pair... which I was again happy with until the same issues arose in less than 2 months. This seems to be symptomatic to this model from klipsch, which is sad, because they could be great. In all, they are great headphones if you think the price justifies and exceptionally short lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Jon G

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great little in ear headphones. I have bought countless pairs of the cheap disposable headphones at electronic stores and they have always just been "ok" . These headphones are terrific. First I must say that the fit is far superior to those old round ones you typically see. These seat in your ear very comfortably and the sound is amazing ! I will not be going back to those old cheap ones again !
customer_reviews.author: BWM

customer_reviews.title: I liked them when I first got them and now after ...
customer_reviews.text: These are ok when they worked. I wouldn't buy them again. I liked them when I first got them and now after less than 18 months the right earbud has gone out. I've had $5.00 ear buds last longer. For 79.00, I regret buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap! 4 months and it's gone
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Looks and sounds great for about 4 months. That's it! completely gone now. Please note I always stored it properly. there was no reason to satrt to fail. By the way, had a similar one from the same brand before and it lasted 1.5 years. Same issue. I should have gone with a different brand. After discussing with friends, it seems this is a very common issue.
customer_reviews.author: M.Silveira

customer_reviews.title: Better than the original!
customer_reviews.text: I had a set of the first S4i until they were recently misplaced :( I really like the upgrades they made to these. The new cords are much more robust and don't tangle like the original pair. They still come with 3 different tips sizes for your ears and the storage pouch has been greatly upgraded to a nice zippered pouch. Very solid. Great sound!
customer_reviews.author: Nerd Fah-Say

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great build quality not so much
customer_reviews.text: Great sound they are great I've had the S4 they lasted me very very very long and great sound they finally went out so i got these just for the inline controls, lasted me about 2 months and went out I would recommend these if you don't use them to work out just to listen to music not much for a gym type of earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Tino

customer_reviews.title: Blocks most ambient noise
customer_reviews.text: These fit comfortably in my ears, and block most ambient noise without making it so quiet that I'm not aware of my surroundings. The inline microphone works really well, making it easy for others to hear me, and for me to change the iphone from phone back to iPod after a call. The little silicone ear buds come in several sizes, so it's easy to get the right fit - though they are astonishingly easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Ikayakcanada

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Short Lifespan.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, but I sweated on them, and they stopped working. Don't waste your money. You can literally buy a pair of earbuds at Kmart with a mic, for $15, that sounds EXACTLY as good. Earbuds never last long enough to justify buying expensive ones. Go buy some $15 J-Lab buds, you'll thank me.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Average earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are not horrible, just one annoying characteristic that has caused me to stop using them. To start off, pros are these buds sit really flush with the ears not causing any obscene objects sticking far out of your ear. The con is the remote/mic is excessively big and sits down around your chest. I usually like to feed by earbuds under my shirt so the cord is not flapping out while moving around. With the mic being down by the chest this makes it a little impractical. I have since stopped using these earbuds because of being consistently annoyed by the location of the remote/mic.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Unique shape, very comfortable sounds great
customer_reviews.text: The flat oval tips allow for long time listening and the sound quality is fantastic. You have to find the right size tips so that you have a proper seal to get the best results. Crisp treble, deep bass...very happy. I had the first gen but as many have pointed out the connection where the plug is wore out. These are considerably more robust and the button mechanism is a little larger which helps if you are adjusting the volume or track without looking. Love these earbuds, paired with a 6th gen Nano, you've got a traveling stereo about the size of a small cookie. Mm, cookie...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. the mister-dude

customer_reviews.title: Box does not say S4i II
customer_reviews.text: Before you call to tell them you got the wrong product, the earphones are shipped in a box that does not say S4i II. It just says S4i on it. It appears one of the main differences that you can use to tell the S4i II apart from the S4i is the flat rather than round ear bud cord. At least that's the case according to the amazon rep.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones for a young man or your Husband.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 20 year old college sophomore. He's gone through several pair over the last year and I wanted to buy him a "decent" pair that didn't break the bank. Well these are great! So let me save you some time going over all the reviews because I already did, and he loves these, wears them every day. They are holding up very well and have great sound. I looked them up on C-Net and watched the video so don't worry, just go ahead and buy these, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine V. Sabo

product_meta.title: Klipsch Image S4i-II Black In-Ear Headphones
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingBring your iTunes playlist to life with the legendary sound of the Image S4i headphones. Designed for audiophiles’ favorite Apple products, the S4i comes with a three-button control and mic, allowing you to control the concert and your phone calls. Our award-winning drivers deliver a full range of frequencies, allowing you to experience your favorite artists like never before. And with the S4i’s comfortable design and durable structure, you can play your passion endlessly. When it comes to comfort, no one beats Klipsch headphones. Our patented oval ear tips naturally fit the contours of your ear canals, providing a secure fit and comfortable long-term wear. With these exclusive ear tips, you’ll also get superior noise isolation, a characteristic that lets you enjoy music at lower, safer volumes, as well as achieve excellent bass response. In addition to unequaled comfort, these patented oval ear tips create a perfect acoustic seal to produce Klipsch's renowned, high-performance sound. Offering the same award-winning acoustics as the Image S4, the Image S4i is equipped with an 8.5mm dual magnet micro-speaker. This advanced audio technology covers a wide frequency range, while delivering dynamic detail for crisp highs, warm mids and deep, smooth bass. The Image S4i’s audio works with virtually any device that has a standard 3.5mm headphone jack and features an Apple-based mic and three-button remote for taking calls and controlling music on iPods, iPhones or iPads. Located on the back of the remote is a directional mic for hands-free, crystal clear phone calls.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


KLIPSCH IMAGE S4I (II) BLACK IN-EAR HEADPHONES
Bring your iTunes playlist to life with the legendary sound of the Image S4i headphones. Designed for your favorite Apple products, the S4i comes with a three-button control and mic, allowing you to control the concert and your phone calls. Our award-winning drivers deliver a full range of frequencies, allowing you to experience your favorite artists like never before. And with the S4i’s comfortable design and durable structure, you can play your passion endlessly.

66 Years of Legendary Sound
The genesis of something very, very special occurred in a tiny tin shed in Hope, Arkansas in 1946. When Paul W. Klipsch invented the Klipschorn, he gave rise to a technology that would impact generations of music lovers. Today, PWK's passion and principles still grace every product we make. Offering the same award-winning acoustics as the original Image S4, the Image S4i is equipped with an 8.5mm dual magnet micro-speaker. This advanced audio technology covers a wide frequency range, while delivering dynamic detail for crisp highs, warm mids and deep, smooth bass. 

The Legend Lives in Your Head
When it comes to comfort, no one beats Klipsch headphones. Our patented oval ear tips naturally fit the contours of your ear canals, providing a secure fit and comfortable long-term wear. They fit better. They feel better. Only Klipsch has them. With these exclusive ear tips, you’ll also get superior noise isolation, a characteristic that lets you enjoy music at lower, safer volumes, as well as achieve excellent bass response. In addition to unequaled comfort, these patented oval ear tips create a perfect acoustic seal to produce the renowned, high-performance Klipsch sound.

Let Your Passion Go to Your Head
The Image S4i’s audio works with virtually any device that has a standard 3.5mm headphone jack and features an Apple-based mic and three-button remote for taking calls and controlling music on iPods, iPhones or iPads. Located on the back of the remote is a directional mic for hands-free, crystal clear phone calls.

Positioned at the cable yoke, the S4i’s mic and remote are exactly where you want and need them when answering calls and controlling music. The microphone is a highly intelligible 360° design with echo cancellation, so you can make and receive phone calls with crystal-clear audio and won’t have to worry about all of the noise around you. 

Your favorite playlists are at your fingertips with the S4i. The plus and minus buttons control volume up and down, while the middle button does the rest of the work. You can also use the middle button to take advantage of the iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 4S, iPhone 5 and iPad’s voice control feature. Just hold down the button and say your command.

Armed with one of the best warranty programs in the industry, with a 2-year replacement policy on all headphone products as opposed to the 1-year offered by many competitors, you can take comfort that your Klipsch headphones will provide years of listening enjoyment. 

Live the Music
Just like a VIP at a concert, you get a bevy of extras with the Image S4i headphone including four pairs of different-sized patented oval ear tips, clothing clip and a protective carrying case. Available in black or white, the S4i also includes a 2-year warranty so you can rest assured that your Klipsch headphones will provide years of listening enjoyment.
feature_bullets: Noise isolating in-ear headphones with 3-button remote + mic
Patented oval ear tips provide comfortable wear for hours
3-button remote for full music + voice control on select Apple products
Award winning sound delivers deep bass and full range clarity

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,101 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
